title: List of earthquakes in Chile
text:
This list of earthquakes in Chile includes every known major earthquake that was felt or with its epicenter within Chile's current boundaries.
Statistics and Map.
Statistics for earthquakes with M ≥ 7.0 in Chile are detailed on the list below.
The region, which is adjacent to the fast-moving <a href="Nazca%20Plate">Nazca Plate</a>, has high tectonic activity. To keep the list manageable, only earthquakes with magnitude ≥ 7.0 will be included, or if it has other notable features like the <a href="2010%20Pichilemu%20earthquake">2010 Pichilemu earthquake</a>. The records for earlier centuries are apparently incomplete.
Of the <a href="Lists%20of%20earthquakes%23Largest%20earthquakes%20by%20magnitude">world's 36 known earthquakes with M ≥ 8.5</a> since the year 1500, one-third occurred in Chile and are shown in the map to the side. Some virtually have the same epicenters like the 1604 and <a href="1868%20Arica%20earthquake">1868</a> (in Arica), the <a href="1730%20Valpara%C3%ADso%20earthquake">1730</a> and 1822 (in Valparaíso), the <a href="1751%20Concepci%C3%B3n%20earthquake">1751</a> and <a href="1835%20Concepci%C3%B3n%20earthquake">1835</a> (in Concepción), and the <a href="1575%20Valdivia%20earthquake">1575</a> and <a href="1837%20Valdivia%20earthquake">1837</a> (in Valdivia).
The strongest known recorded in modern times was also in Chile, the <a href="1960%20Valdivia%20earthquake">1960 Valdivia earthquake</a>.
